summary: An email from Mark Wonulski to an unspecified detective, forwarding two photos taken on June 11, 2019, in Sardinia, Italy, that he believes depict Jeffrey Epstein and an unidentified female accomplice. The sender offers the photos as potential evidence following Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Mark Wonulski
persons.context: Individual who took photographs during a vacation in Sardinia, Italy, on June 11, 2019, and believes they captured Jeffrey Epstein and an unidentified woman. He forwarded the photos to a detective after Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Jan
persons.context: Mark Wonulski's wife, who first identified the man in the photos as Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual Mark Wonulski and his wife believe is depicted in the photographs taken in Sardinia, Italy, on June 11, 2019. The email is sent in the context of his recent arrest.

connections.description: Married couple who were on vacation together in Sardinia, Italy, when the photographs were taken.
Depicted together in photographs taken at a beach in Sardinia, Italy, on June 11, 2019. The email suggests she may be an accomplice.

events.title: Photographs Taken in Sardinia
events.description: Mark Wonulski took photographs at a beach restaurant in Sardinia, Italy, which he later believed captured Jeffrey Epstein and an unidentified woman.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest in New Jersey
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested in New Jersey after arriving from Paris, France. This event prompted Mark Wonulski to review and submit his vacation photos.

keyFacts: Photographs were taken on June 11, 2019, at a beach restaurant in Sardinia, Italy.
The tipster, Mark Wonulski, and his wife Jan believe the photos show Jeffrey Epstein with an unidentified woman who may be an accomplice.
The email was sent on August 20, 2019, after Epstein's arrest in New Jersey, which prompted the submission.
The photos are offered as potential evidence to an unspecified detective.
